newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israeli troops enter self-ruled Ramallah - radio.
newsitem.headline: Israeli troops enter self-ruled Ramallah - radio.

text.p: Israel Radio said Israeli troops entered Palestinian-ruled Ramallah on Wednesday in pursuit of gunmen who fired at them from inside the West Bank city.

The radio, reporting from Ramallah, said it was the first time Israeli soldiers had entered a self-rule enclave since the Jewish state began handing over parts of the West Bank and Gaza to Palestinian self-rule in 1994.
Palestinian demonstrators rushed towards the checkpoint where the Israeli troops were stationed, witnesses said.
The Israelis opened fire, wounding more Palestinians, including police.
Palestinian police over loudspeakers urged the youths to get back. Ramallah hospital said earlier at least 160 Palestinians were wounded in the clashes.
Palestinian demonstrations erupted in Jerusalem, the West Bank and Gaza Strip earlier in protest at Israeli policy in Jerusalem.
